column2: CALIFORNIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much safer.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 2. Vehicles entering or exiting a roundabout:
column4: must slow down.
column6: must yield to all traffic.
column8: have the right-of-way.

column2: 3. Which of the following is true about railroad crossings?
column4: Trains cannot swerve out of the way. Never stop on the railroad tracks.
column6: Flashing red lights indicate you must stop and wait.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 4. If you see orange construction signs or cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 5. When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes in your direction, you may turn from:
column4: the lane closest to the center of the road.
column6: the lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.
column8: either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

column2: 6. What should you do when you see a Wrong Way sign?
column4: Come to a complete stop and call law enforcement.
column6: Immediately make a U-turn.
column8: Drive to the side of the road and stop. When safe, back out or turn around and return to the road you were on.

column2: 7. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 8. California’s “Basic Speed Law” says you must:
column4: keep your speed close to that of other traffic.
column6: always drive at the posted speed limit.
column8: never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

column2: 9. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 10. It is night. A vehicle coming towards you has its high beams on, which makes it hard to see the road ahead. You should:
column4: look straight ahead in your lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.

column2: 11. Whose responsibility is it to know how your medications affect your driving?
column4: Yours
column6: Your physician’s
column8: Your pharmacist’s

column2: 12. This blue sign means parking is allowed:
column4: for disabled persons without a special placard or plate.
column6: only for persons in wheelchairs.
column8: only for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 13. You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle, if the yellow line next to:
column4: your side of the road is a broken line.
column6: the other side of the road is a solid line.
column8: the other side of the road is a broken line.

column2: 14. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: when the road is slippery.
column6: at railroad crossings.
column8: The other answers are correct.

column2: 15. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Remain calm and relaxed.
column6: Try to move away safely.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. Do not cross double solid yellow lines in the center of the roadway to:
column4: make a left turn.
column6: enter a private driveway.
column8: pass other vehicles.

column2: 17. The maximum speed limit on most California highways is:
column4: 55 MPH
column6: 70 MPH
column8: 65 MPH

column2: 18. When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:
column4: have passed the the other vehicle’s front bumper.
column6: cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column8: see the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.

column2: 19. When should you use your headlights?
column4: one hour before sunset until one hour after sunrise.
column6: any time you can’t see at least two miles ahead.
column8: any time you have trouble seeing others or being seen.

column2: 20. Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?
column4: Away from the curb
column6: Parallel to the curb.
column8: Into the curb

column2: 21. When may you legally go around or under a railroad crossing gate?
column4: Under no circumstances.
column6: When the warning lights are not flashing.
column8: When you can see clearly in both directions.

column2: 22. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: indicate no pass zones.

column2: 23. California has a Basic Speed Law, which means that:
column4: drivers must always drive the standard (basic) speed limit.
column6: weather and road conditions should never affect the speed at which you drive.
column8: drivers may never drive faster than is safe for the prevailing road and weather conditions.

column2: 24. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge left.
column6: traffic must merge right.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 25. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column6: Diamond
column8: Pennant

column2: 26. At night, if an oncoming vehicle fails to dim its high beams, look:
column4: toward the center of the roadway.
column6: toward the right edge of the roadway.
column8: straight ahead in your lane.

column2: 27. If a pedestrian is in a crosswalk in the middle of a block:
column4: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
column6: The pedestrian has the right-of-way.
column8: Vehicles have the right-of-way, but drivers must legally take care for the pedestrian’s safety.

column2: 28. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white
column8: yellow; black

column2: 29. The speed limit for a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted.
column4: 15 MPH
column6: 25 MPH
column8: 20 MPH

column2: 30. You are required to wear your safety belt in a moving vehicle:
column4: and failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.
column6: unless you are riding the back of a pickup/camper.
column8: unless the vehicle was manufactured before 1975.

column2: 31. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: pump your brakes to test the traction of your tires.
column6: decrease the distance that you look ahead of your vehicle.
column8: avoid making fast turns and fast stops.

column2: 32. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.
column8: Stop and let the pedestrian finish.

column2: 33. To assist the officer in conducting a traffic break, you should:
column4: activate your emergency flashers to warn other drivers there is a hazard ahead.
column6: attempt to drive past the patrol vehicle.
column8: accelerate until the patrol vehicle has turned off its emergency lights

column2: 34. You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal light turns yellow. You should:
column4: stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.
column6: slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.
column8: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

column2: 35. At an intersection with a flashing yellow signal light, you should:
column4: Slow down and cross carefully.
column6: Watch for other vehicles and maintain your current speed.
column8: Stop before crossing the intersection.

column2: 36. When merging onto a freeway, you should be driving:
column4: at the legal freeway speed limit.
column6: at or near the same speed as the freeway traffic.
column8: slower than the freeway traffic.
